title: Indefinite protest planned over proposed reforms
byline: An activist group has announced plans to commence an indefinite protest outside the Ministry of Education on Monday, opposing proposed education reforms and demanding the resignation of the Education Minister.

title: Bob Weir, Grateful Dead co-founder, dies aged 78
byline:
Bob Weir, the guitarist who co-founded the Grateful Dead, has died aged 78.
Weir, a cornerstone of the California psychedelic rock group and many of its offshoots, passed away after a battle with cancer and lung issues, according to a post on his Instagram.

title: Early childhood care a social responsibility: Ministers
byline: Minister of Women and Child Affairs Ms. Saroja Paulraj said the standardisation and development of early childhood development has been identified as a primary objective of her Ministry for 2026.

title: Govt. to standardise preschool education, introduce unified curriculum: PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said the Government has commenced measures to bring preschool education under a single national framework, align it with a unified curriculum, conduct preschool teacher training systematically and ensure quality standards.

title: National communication programme for Child Health Promotion launched
byline: The National Communication Programme for Child Health Promotion, aimed at promoting social and behavioural change (SBCC) among early childhood children, was launched today (10) at Temple Trees under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Opposition and Govt. supporters stage separate protests in Matugama
byline: Two separate protests were held today (10) in Matugama, drawing significant public attention as opposing groups demonstrated on different issues.

title: Flexible work shifts approved for public servants during Ramadan
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government has directed all state institutions to introduce flexible work shifts for Muslim public servants to facilitate the observance of religious practices during the holy month of Ramadan.

title: Sri Lanka records highest ever emigrant remittances in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) announced that the country received a record-high amount of emigrant remittances in 2025, the highest in the 40-year history of foreign employment.

title: Over 2,200 CEB employees seek minister’s intervention over delayed VRS exit
byline: A collective of more than 2,200 employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) who applied for the Voluntary Retirement Scheme (VRS) has urged the Energy Minister to intervene immediately, citing severe hardship caused by delays in gazetting the “Appointed Date” for CEB restructuring.

title: Depression over southwest Bay of Bengal to cross Mullaittivu coast this evening
byline: The depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal is likely to cross the Mullaittivu coast around this evening, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: TIN mandatory for vehicle registration and ownership transfers from January 5
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has made it mandatory to enter the Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) when registering vehicles and transferring vehicle ownership, with effect from January 5.

title: Tourist child rescued after falling from Little Adam’s Peak
byline: A foreign tourist child was rescued today after falling from a steep cliff at Little Adam’s Peak, officials said.

title: Pakistan Tour of Sri Lanka: Ticket update
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) said that spectators who purchased tickets for the abandoned 2nd T20I will be issued a free ticket for the 3rd T20I, scheduled to be played on Sunday.

title: US warns Iran amid growing antigovernment demonstrations and clashes
byline: United States President Donald Trump says Iran is in “big trouble” and again warned he could order military strikes as videos showed antigovernment protests raging across the country, and authorities blacked out the internet to restrain growing unrest.

title: Department of Examinations issues revised schedule for 2025 G.C.E. A/L exams
byline: Department of Examinations, Sri Lanka has released a revised schedule for the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examinations following disruptions caused by adverse weather conditions.

title: Vehicle imports surge strained country’s external sector hit by global uncertainties
byline: Import of vehicles, largely reflecting the release of pent-up demand at a scale much higher than expected, exerted pressure last year on Sri Lanka’s external sector that faced significant challenges amidst elevated global uncertainties, arising from shifts in global trade policies and heightened geopolitical tensions, according to the Central Bank.

title: Man arrested with narcotics in Negombo
byline: A 32-year-old man from Negombo was taken into custody after police uncovered a cache of narcotics during a search of a suspicious vehicle near the Periyamulla–Eththukala railway crossing.

title: Nothing to discuss with Govt on grade VI English module controversy: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa on Sunday said there was nothing to discuss with the government over the controversy surrounding alleged inappropriate references in the Grade VI English Language module introduced under the new education reforms.

title: Saudi Fund grants USD 6m for Ditwah-hit roads
byline: Sri Lanka will receive an additional USD 6 million from the Saudi Fund for Development to rehabilitate roads damaged by Cyclone Ditwah, the Ministry of Transport said.

title: Controversy erupts over alleged ‘hidden LGBTQ promotion’ at ILO C190 awareness event
byline: As the Sri Lankan government moves ahead with plans to stop violence and harassment at workplaces by ratifying the International Labour Organisation’s (ILO) Convention No. 190 (C190), a controversy has arisen. Critics claim the move is also being used to quietly promote and normalise LGBTQ-related ideas under the cover of labour reforms.

title: Trump seeks $100bn for Venezuela oil, but Exxon boss says country ’uninvestable’
byline: US President Donald Trump has asked for at least $100bn (£75bn) in oil industry spending for Venezuela, but received a lukewarm response at the White House as one executive warned the South American country was currently ’’uninvestable’’.

title: Sri Lanka emerges as third fastest growing destination for Australian tourists
byline: ​Sri Lanka has secured its position as the third fastest-growing travel destination for Australian tourists in 2025, recording a 19 percent year-on-year growth in arrivals.

title: Trump says US needs to ’own’ Greenland to prevent Russia and China from taking it
byline: President Donald Trump says the US needs to ’’own’’ Greenland to prevent Russia and China from doing so.

title: All set for international bidding for oil and gas exploration, development
byline: The energy companies from countries such as Qatar and India have already shown interest in participation in the exploration and development of hydrocarbon resources (oil and natural gas) in four blocks of the Mannar basin, an official said yesterday.

title: TikTok reveals Sri Lanka’s top searches in 2025
byline: TikTok recently shared the top searched words on the platform in Sri Lanka in 2025, offering a snapshot of what Sri Lankans were most curious about this year — from the celebrities and creators they follow, to the music and dramas they can’t stop talking about, the places they’re planning to visit, and the moments driving conversation across the platform.

title: Nobel Committee rejects Machado’s Trump prize share bid
byline: Nobel Peace Prize laureate and opposition leader Maria Corina Machado expressed her desire to share the Nobel Prize with U.S. President Donald Trump, prompting the Norwegian Nobel Committee—which administers the Nobel Peace Prize—to state, “Once announced, the Nobel Prize cannot be revoked, shared, or transferred to another person.”

title: Sri Lanka Postal Service achieves record revenue
byline: Sri Lanka’s postal service has recorded a remarkable turnaround in 2025, surpassing revenue targets set by the Treasury and signalling a major revival after years of stagnation.

title: Sri Lanka to boost domestic aviation
byline: Plans are underway to implement a programme aimed at strengthening Sri Lanka’s domestic aviation sector to support the growth of the tourism industry, said Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Anura Karunathilake.

title: US warns Americans to leave Venezuela immediately
byline: The U.S. government issued a new security alert Saturday urging Americans in Venezuela to leave the country immediately, citing security concerns and the U.S. government’s inability to provide emergency assistance, according to the U.S. Embassy Caracas.

title: CID probe into breach of Public Security Ministry website
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has initiated an investigation into a suspected cyber intrusion involving the official website of the Ministry of Public Security.

title: First India-assisted Bailey Bridge opened
byline: The first Bailey Bridge constructed under India’s Assistance Package for post-Cyclone Ditwah reconstruction was opened to traffic on Sunday, restoring a crucial road connection between Sri Lanka’s Central and Uva provinces.

title: Low-pressure area weakens, warnings withdrawn
byline: The Department of Meteorology has announced that the low-pressure area over the Gulf of Mannar is continuing to weaken, resulting in a gradual reduction in its impact on Sri Lanka’s weather conditions.

title: Bob Weir, Grateful Dead co-founder, dies aged 78
byline:
Bob Weir, the guitarist who co-founded the Grateful Dead, has died aged 78.
Weir, a cornerstone of the California psychedelic rock group and many of its offshoots, passed away after a battle with cancer and lung issues, according to a post on his Instagram.

title: Bride and groom among 8 killed in gas cylinder blast at Pakistan wedding
byline: A gas cylinder explosion early Sunday after a wedding reception at a home in Pakistan’s capital killed at least eight people, including the bride and groom, police and officials said.

title: Four arrested over alleged Grand Pass shooting plot
byline: Police arrested four suspects in connection with an alleged plan to carry out a shooting in the Grand Pass area.

title: Do not link Indian housing project with disaster relief, Arullsamy urges Govt.
byline: Vice President of the Democratic People’s Front and Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) Barath Arullsamy has called on the government to assume full responsibility for providing disaster relief housing to plantation families urging authorities not to merge such efforts with the Indian Housing Project.

title: Re-start probe on All Saints Church bomb drama: Catholic Church in SL
byline: The Catholic Church in Sri Lanka today urged the government to restart the probe into the bomb drama at the All Saints Church in Borella.

title: Restoration of Northern, Talaimannar railway lines begins
byline: Restoration work on the Northern and Talaimannar railway lines began today (11), backed by a USD 5 million grant from the Government of India.

title: Education reforms should suit the country, not the JVP: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa said that if the President believes education reforms compatible with the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) are also compatible with the country, then a wrong decision has been taken.
